name: San Diego County COVID-19 Update – 6-4-2021
description: Here is today’s COVID-19 update from the County Health and Human Services Agency with data through June 3.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Here is today’s COVID-19 update from the County Health and Human Services Agency with data through June 3.
Vaccination Progress:

Doses delivered: More than 4.17 million.
Doses administered: More than 3.73 million.
Received at least one shot: Over 2 million or 73% of San Diegans 12 and older.
Fully vaccinated: Over 1.63 million or 58.3%.
The goal: fully vaccinate 75% of San Diego County residents 12 and older or 2,101,936 people.
To date, 97.3% of the goal population has received at least one vaccine and 77.7% are fully vaccinated.
More vaccination information can be found coronavirus-sd.com/vaccine.

State Metrics:

San Diego County’s state-calculated, adjusted case rate is currently 1.7 cases per 100,000 residents, placing the County in the Yellow Tier for one week.
The County needs to have two weeks with a case rate of less than two cases per 100,000 residents to fully move into the Yellow Tier.
The testing positivity percentage is 1.3% and the County is in the Yellow Tier.
The health equity metric is 1.5%, placing the County in the Yellow Tier.
CDPH assesses counties on a weekly basis. The next report is scheduled for Tuesday, June 8.

Community Setting Outbreaks:

One new community outbreak was confirmed June 3 in a business setting.
In the past seven days (May 28 through June 3), nine community outbreaks were confirmed.
The community outbreaks trigger is more than seven in a 7-day period.

Testing:

17,437 tests were reported to the County on June 3, and the percentage of new positive cases was 0.7%.
The 14-day rolling average percentage of positive cases is 0.7%. Target is less than 8.0%.
The 7-day, daily average of tests is 9,350.

Cases, Hospitalizations and ICU Admissions:

126 COVID-19 cases were reported to the County on June 3. The region’s total is now 280,555.
15,434 or 5.5% of all cases have required hospitalization.
1,707 or 0.6% of all cases and 11.1% of hospitalized cases had to be admitted to an intensive care unit.

Deaths:

Two new deaths were reported June 3. The region’s total is 3,763.
One of the deceased was a man in his 60s with underlying medical conditions and the other was a man in his 80s with underlying medical conditions. Both died on June 2.

More Information:
The more detailed data summaries found on the County’s coronavirus-sd.com website are updated around 5 p.m. daily.
